Package ex4.geometry

Interface GeoShape

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Circle2D, Point2D, Rect2D, Segment2D, Triangle2D
    public interface GeoShape
    This interface represents a geometric (2D) shape in the plane. The methods includes: moving a shape by a vector, testing if a shape contains a point, centerOfMass, area, perimeter, toString and a method (getPoints) for getting the points representing this GeoShape. Ex4: you should NOT change this interface!
    Author:
    boaz.benmoshe

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      double area()
      Computes the area of this shape, in case of a point, and a segment should return 0.
      Point2D centerOfMass()
      Computes the center of mass of this shape
      boolean contains​(Point2D ot)
      Computes if the point (ot) falls inside this (closed) shape.
      GeoShape copy()
      This method computes a new (deep) copy of this GeoShape
      Point2D[] getPoints()
      This method return the dominant point of the shape: Point2D, a copy of it.
      void move​(Point2D vec)
      Move this shape by the vector 0,0-->vec Note: this method changes the inner state of the object.
      double perimeter()
      Computes the perimeter of this shape, return 0 in case of a circle and the length of the segment in case of a segment.
      java.lang.String toString()
      This method returns a String representing this shape, such that one can use this string for saving the shape into a text file.

    • Method Detail

      • contains

        boolean contains​(Point2D ot)
        Computes if the point (ot) falls inside this (closed) shape. Note: Assumes a closed shape - aka if ot is on the boundary it is inside the shape.
        Parameters:
        ot - - a query 2D point
        Returns:
        true iff the point falls with in this shape (as a closed shape).

      • centerOfMass

        Point2D centerOfMass()
        Computes the center of mass of this shape
        Returns:
        a 2D point

      • area

        double area()
        Computes the area of this shape, in case of a point, and a segment should return 0.
        Returns:

      • perimeter

        double perimeter()
        Computes the perimeter of this shape, return 0 in case of a circle and the length of the segment in case of a segment.
        Returns:

      • move

        void move​(Point2D vec)
        Move this shape by the vector 0,0-->vec Note: this method changes the inner state of the object.
        Parameters:
        vec - - a vector from the 0,0

      • copy

        GeoShape copy()
        This method computes a new (deep) copy of this GeoShape
        Returns:
        a deep copy of this GeoShape.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        This method returns a String representing this shape, such that one can use this string for saving the shape into a text file.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representing this shape

      • getPoints

        Point2D[] getPoints()
        This method return the dominant point of the shape: Point2D, a copy of it. Segment: the two end points Circle: center and a point on the boundary (in this order). Rectangle: all 4 points Triangle: all 3 points Ellipse: two centers and a point on the boundary Polygon: all points (in order). Path: all points (in order).
        Returns:
        an array with all the points representing this GeoShape.
